column4: ok so, syslogd is running on my pc, my routers syslog feature is pointed at my pc's ip addy, so why am i not getting information from the router..?
did you get my suggestion earlier about rebooting the router or doing something on it to cause it to trigger some syslog-relevant messages?
ok, you got a firewall running?
hmm .. was the firewall turned off when you rebooted the router?
ok, could be something in your syslogd.conf probably
any clue where to start looking, its a default install as of now
i cant seeem to find anything in syslogd.conf either -- the next thing i would do is verify that syslogd is listening on udp port 514 and that it is indeed accessible from an external source
what app/daemon are you referring to?

things are peculiar in the windows world -- and i've never heard of this wallwatcher thing -- sound like "weight-watcher" or something -- outside of windows, syslog is used extensively .. and is almost 100% ubiquitous
so it's a syslog daemon then
so has wallwatcher had better luck with the router?
we all have those days -- and usually its just something very small we have overlooked
and picking everything up from the router?
what was the last command of the router logged by syslog -- there might be indication of why logs are now suspended
one another thing we havent really ruled out -- are you sure the messages arent being logged in any other of the files under /var/log ?
what was the command to grep all files in a folder ?
sudo grep -inHR 'keyword' /path/to/folder/*
i also found this -- check the second section about network aware syslog - http://www.aboutdebian.com/syslog.htm
it's likely that syslog is filtering messages out because they dont meet a severity level -- you might want an entry in your syslogd.conf thats trapping _everything_
and is that the logfile you are seeing that last message from half an hour ago?
did you see that section about adding the extra options in /etc/init.d/sysklogd ?
were those entries already there? or did you have to add them in now?
ok, was syslogd restarted? (just making sure)
have you triggered any activity since?
